1: A Psalm of David, when he fled from his son Absalom.
2: Adonai, how many are my foes! Many are rising up against me!
3: Many are saying to my soul: “There is no deliverance for him in God.” Selah
4: But You, Adonai, are a shield around me, my glory and the lifter of my head.
5: I cry out to Adonai with my voice, and He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah
6: I lie down and sleep. I awake—for Adonai sustains me.
7: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people all around who have taken their stand against me.
8: Arise, Adonai! Deliver me, my God! For you strike all my enemies on the cheek. You shatter the teeth of the wicked.
9: Deliverance belongs to Adonai.[a] Let Your blessing be on Your people. Selah
